Hi,

I would like to encourage people to talk more of combining the
Semanti=
c Web and REST. Much of the research I have read on the
Semantic Web is abo=
ut extending the standard SOAP WS-* stack. This
includes WSMO and OWL-S amo=
ngst others.

My opinion is that one could create the Semantic Web with RES=
Tful Web
Services by just adding semantic annotations to existing Web pages=
.
This is an oversimplification I know, but I can't help feeling
frustrated=
 about all the effort that are spent on OWL-S and WSMO etc.

Initiatives su=
ch as OWL-S and WSMO has got to be dead ends, I cannot
imagine how anyone w=
ould create a service for accessing even 20% of
the information being avail=
able on the Web today. Adding some semantic
tags to regular Web pages howev=
er, that one can cope with.

RDF is after all, called Resource Description =
Framework, not
Complicated Web Service Description Framework ;)

Do you agr=
ee?
